Text.Value: No, Lunkbug. Our work is bigger than any one of us - even Wulbren.
Let's not dawdle. Nowhere down here is safe, however it looks.
I don't know half of what they're saying, but at least they're peaceful.
Thulla, what have they done to you...
Lunkbug... the workshop will be a lot quieter without you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grief stricken husband - trying to be wry about his dead husband

Text.Value: Thulla. Somehow, you look worse than last I saw you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Fond, seeing a favourite employee / daughter figure after thinkin she was dead

Text.Value: Maybe... maybe the myconids thought they were helping.
Enough dallying. We need to get back to Baldur's Gate.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to put a line under everything they've suffered, look forward to the next step

Text.Value: Aye - same as us, I expect.
We won't stay long. We're done counting on the kindness of strangers.
From one slaughter to the bloody next.

EditorData.NodeContext: Beholding a load of dead bodies in what was supposed to be a safe haven.

Text.Value: We're done down here. Can't believe I'm saying it, but I miss the damn sun.
Beldron, you bastard. You were supposed to lead us out. Not... leave us behind.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bitter, grief stricken about his dead husband

Text.Value: We've had some rest. Maybe we can still go back for the others.

EditorData.NodeContext: broaching a topic that's been shut down before - referencing his captured friends

Text.Value: Thanks boss. Would be looking a lot worse if not for help from a friend.
We should've stayed in the city - Wulbren's quest be damned.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sarcastic and scornful of the charmisatic leader who got his husband killed

Synopsis: Deep gnome slaves were rescued from the Grymforge. All who survived and (probably, if alive) Thulla discuss what happened to them, and their current situation. Main character who starts this AD is Beldron, but if he dead Lunkbug will do it instead.
